Ok food cheap prices for Pho

Their Vietnamese food are awesome, really good, no doubt on it.  But the pan fry food are not that great, I tried one of their pan fry noodles, doesn't taste good at all.  But over all, this is a great restaurant to go to.  Very big and spacious!!!!
Taste good, services good.

This restaurant is always an A plus. It's not a typical "quÃ¡n nháº­u"(restaurant where you can have special dishes) you see on the street. The food is extremely yummy, tasty. The price will be  $$ to $$$ but I think it's worthy. One thing I like is the serves are all so nice and extremely professional. They can provide you some information about the food or suggest what courses are the best to eat. ( Catch of the day).
This restaurant has 4 buildings and they are all next to each other. You can't miss their flashy neon signs when you pass.
Expensive, the food is often over cook

I prefer to rate 4.3 stars for this place. Everything is ok, esp services and waitresses are very helpful, except some equipment are out of date, look old or lost its funtions.
Food in this restaurant is excellent, you can try variety of Vietnamese dishes, all material are fresh and clean.
It also have a good place for parking, the fee is equal to the others but I wonder why I park on the street also have to pay money for parking, it is public, not belong to the restaurant, so awkward!
Just went there for a bowl of noodle soup and some dim sum for lunch. Overall good experience.

The food was good for the low price. The service was a bit slow and it took a long time to get our food. If you are looking for a place with air conditioning, decent food, low price, with low price alcohol bottles like Johhnie Walker to drink and sit around for a long time then this is a spot.
Good fresh food located at great location. Street parking for cars. Price is not too expensive either. They also have live singers is you want to sit outside

Good location, food is so so, price are expensive. Staff friendly and helpful, waitress at table very young and beautifull with special drinking skill.
Be right back, if someone else pay the bill.
Good place to hangout with friends or family at night because they have many nice view and reasonable price. However, the taste of food is not too special and sometime it's quite crowd
Good for groups and events thanks to location and their open layout, with private "VIP" rooms and add-on karaoke. Look elsewhere if you're looking for authentic local food.

Missing many menu items. Not busy, but service was unorganized.

Nice place for Dim sum and Chinese food in the central of the city. High quality food and good service.
One of the popular resraurant that is always crowded at night.

I heard that it was delicious, but it was very ordinary. Considering the price range, the cost performance is not high.
And, the customer service level is very low.
When they dine as a guest, they may not be able to think about what the minimum service is like.  I don't think I will go to the restraint myself.

I really miss eating peking duck 3 ways: duck skin wrap, duck meat with noodle or rice, and duck bone in soup or hot pot. Not sure why no restaurants that I have been to in the US cook peking duck this way. My favorite is always the skin wrap, but I'm a little sad that they don't prep the skin at your table anymore. The fermented tofu hotpot with duck bone is very delicious as well. The cua lá»™t with salted egg sauce is very good too. Service is a little slow.

Nice place for chinese food, their menu is so various thay make us hard to choose. Itâ€™s also a common place for dining at night, they even open the whole night till the morning. Food quality is good enough, staff service is ok.

One of the restaurants open late night in HCMC. MÃ¬ vá»‹t tiá»m was delcious; tasty broth with plenty of duck meat (noodles were also perfectly cooked). We also ordered the banh canh gio heo and mÃ¬ hoÃ nh thÃ¡nh.  Banh canh was okay, but definitely would choose the mÃ¬ hoÃ nh thÃ¡nh over banh canh.
2am in HCM and hungry after Club: stay at tan hai van. Many specialities incl shark fin soup. The black chickens also very famous in here. Try it out!
Came for the Tim sum here.. food is below quality compare to other specialist in dim sum dim tu tac . Environment is OK.
Havent been back in years, yet the food still taste delicious like usual!!
One of the OG Chinese-Cantonese restaurant in HCMC. For those who like having supper, this place opens late to satisfy club goers as your last stop supper spot before heading back to sleep.

Situated in D1, so that explains the high price. But the managers can speak Mandarin as well as Vietnamese. We believe Cantonese as well.

The crab dongfeng is extremely delicious... We have not tasted any other Chinese restaurants coming close to it in the years we've been in HCM. Of course it comes with a price, depending on the crab's weight.

Try the black pepper beef. Not like other beef.. They cook it such that it still has chewyness and tenderness in it and with the spice of the black pepper, wow!

The jielan when we 1st saw it served, we were quite depressed as it was only just stalks.. But unlike other restaurants, they were soft and we ended up clearing the entire dish.

If you are into Chinese food, this is the place to go, but be willing to pay.

For non smokers, please let the staff know, else u will have clowns who will puff away in the air conditioned place.

Update in June 2023: restaurant now has a stage on level 2 with singers but I find my favourite Crab Vermicelli has deproved greatly , maybe they have changed the chef. The price was still high,  probably that explains the crowd.

This place serves great seafood fried rice and mafa-tofu. The restaurant is clean and so are the restrooms. However, the kitchen is in another location outside the supper room, therefore the food is cooked and brought through the broad outside street. It seems like they do not know the problem of this serving manner. While the food is brought to the table from the kitchen, it will be sprayed with all the pollutants in the street and this place just serves it haha. If this was okay, I would hadjust eaten on the street. I did not just pay to eat inside, but also to eat that are cooked and served properly, also with the kitchen windows and doors closed. If you wanted to show your cleasiness of your kitchen, at least install a glass wall please.
Best Chinese food in Saigon. Menu is variety and price is decent. They're open 24/24 which is good for tourists who looking for restaurants late night.
Service is possible the worst I've experienced in my life. Food is mediocre. Would not recommend this place. To rub it in they charge 10k for motorbike parking as you leave.

The staff could not speak proper English so thought we ordered a dish that we didnâ€™t want to. They didnâ€™t want to take it back and we had to pay full price for it. The noodles tasted like instant noodles. The chicken that was served with it consisted mainly out of bones. Would not recommend to eat here. You had to pay extra for the napkins they put on the table and they donâ€™t have change if you pay separately.

Ohk. First of all, i cant deny the food taste great. Just wondering how long it take to cook 2 salted egg buns and a plate of stir fried noodle?  Well im sure its wont take longer than an hour. Sitting here looking at other people who got here later than us but got their food serve first is really annoying.
Never eat here again
The food here is diverse to my taste and the price is not too expensive. The hidden duck noodles here are greatğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ â€¦

This is a great Chinese restaurant, I highly recommend you should go here and try special here. And then when you finish the meal, you should order Tofu dessert with coconut milk and sugar ginger. Another thing is Kim Sa Bao as well
Good food 24/7, i come here late at night for good dim sum and seafood.  This place is always crowded even at 2am in the morning.  They have indoor and outdoor seating as well.

It's a big disappointment coming back after a long time.
Some dishes have no taste at all, and some are extremely salty.
It's overrated and doesn't taste like Cantonese food at all. Never come back.
The better after-hours, after-drinking place to eat compared to the other popular restaurant right across the street.
Dimsum and Mapa tofu is the best!!!
Best chineses food in Saigon. Open 24/24
Best Chinese food I've ever had in Saigon! Highly recommend
Awesome dimsum and chinese food. Service is slow

A place with super good food like: black chicken steam with herbals. Nice noodle and many special foood. The price is good and reasonable. Citizen usually come here after they party or hangout . Cause this restaurant open untill 5am

The food part of this place is that it's open till very late at night. I found the food just average but the portion was big. The service here was fast and they understood our orders without us needing to explain a few times.

Had some dim sum at this place... looks good just not my taste... pork is really gamy. Soft shell crab is really floury if you want to go somewhere really good go to "Ngan Dinh Saigon." Not a far walk from Liberty Central Riverside Hotel!
My favorite Chinese restaurant in Saigon. Will definitely be back!
A good central chinese restaurant. Service is slow

Came here with the family and enjoyed our cozy lunch inside. Plenty of selections to choose from, food is prepared timely and tasty as always, staff is friendly, valet parking is available at reasonable price, I keep coming here again and again
Love the food here. Very fresh and tasty.

Little cowed even at 8p.m. Lucky I made reservation. There were flies everywhere. I thought its top restaurant based on the review. The food is just OK. Nothing special or stand out. I ordered perking duck and couple of dumpings, chicken feet. Not recommended perking duck. May be they were too busy, so the service not good.
Great food, decent service and love the ambience!
Food is ok, served fast, not too good compared to other Chinese restaurants, and price is not cheap at all. But the space is quite nice, staffs are friendly and helpful enough.
Wow.. the freshest and delicious Chinese food in Saigon
Nice food, open from 10AM - 6AM next day
Good food, big portions, and always popular with the locals.

Very delicious and friendly service.
Especially, I like æ°´é¤ƒå­.

Very quick service and helpful staff, even it's crowded but they still serve our foods within 5 minutes. Chinese cuisine, very tasty but a little bit oily, very fresh ingredients. Must try seafood noodle soup. Good location just about 500m far from Ben Thanh market. Reasonable price compares to quality of food.

ThereÂ areÂ soÂ manyÂ kindsÂ ofÂ foodÂ thatIÂ can'tÂ decideÂ whatÂ toÂ order.
I wish there was a picture on the menu.
Chinese restaurant. Good food.
Nice Chinese cuisines restaurant recommended by locals .
Good , croded chinese restaurant
Traditional dimsum, chinese dishes and seafood. Delicious food and nice service. High cost.
Nice location. Food and cooking are ok. Not cheap prices. Not comfortable seats. Not clean place. Not nice service. Should improve washroom.
Delicious meal with original china taste.
Foods were good but they had us sit on the upstair where there was a bad smell and the seats were not comfortable.
Not such a good food, very bad not next time

The worst food I've had in my 2 weeks in this city.
Ordered chicken and vegetables, soup and for vegetables ordered some okra (lady fingers).
The chicken was completely flavorless and tough. The soup was so overly sour I couldn't even eat it. And the okra (which I was expecting to be healthy), was breaded and deep fried.  Bottom all the 3 dishes tasted horrible, and the bill was about $30 usd. They also included a 5% service charge however the service was pretty bad as well, all the staff seem to be rude or in a bad mood.  Never again!

Itâ€™s been a couple years before I went back to the restaurant. Unfortunately, Iâ€™m so disappointed with the service and food here. We had a family meeting at the restaurant last week. Here are all we received from the restaurant:
1. Slow and neglected service: all servers were standing in the front and kept chatting to each other, they didnâ€™t pay attention when we needed them. They also gave us an attitude when we asked them to refill hot water in teapot.
2. Ordering: I asked them to give me sometimes to review menu and discussed to my family, he, however kept standing next to us and rushing us to order. That way made me feel rushed and uncomfortable.
We ordered water bottles, they didnâ€™t have enough, even though we only ordered 5.
We ordered beer bottles, they brought out cans saying they ran out of bottles. Fine.
3. The food was fairly ok, but it was overcharged in compared to the quality.
Beijing duck is the only nice dish in my opinion. Everything was fine until vegetable stir-fried noodles of my mom came out, half of the vegetables smell bad (the smell like when you store vegetables for too long and its getting mouldy) and taste sour. We spoke to supervisor, he insisted that was the way vegetables were. My mom told him to smell the vegetables, he said he would inspect the kitchen, but never came back till we were about to leave without a proper response.
4. Come to the bill: they charged us bottles instead of cans. Itâ€™s unbelievable. Not too much to pay, but the way theyâ€™re serving customers and stealing little money from them are not the way a fancy restaurant in heart of saigon should do.

Seems a very popular place so we decided to try it. In short, the food is not very good, the serving sizes are very small and it is way overpriced. This view is held also by my Vietnamese girlfriend  It is however conveniently open late.

Recommend Beijing duck, chicken salad and dim sum. Broken tables are a disappointment. Staff can be more approachable. Open for 24 hours so the place gets even busier after 9 pm to cater for bar and restaurant staff who have finished their work but have nowhere else to go.

I waited a long time before reviewing this restaurant, mainly because it is so busy. This is hands down my go-to spot for late-night food, dim sum breakfast, and Chinese seafood. The service here is on point.
They normally get busy around 11pm after the dinner rush because this is spot to hit after a night on the town. My friends and I have been here dozens of times. It has never let us down. From fresh juices to beer. Noodle bowls or fried rice. This is the spot.
I have so many pictures I will just post the most recent with this review. I highly recommend the banh cuon chien XO sauce. All the dim sum is on point. Soups, family style dinners... Fresh seafood! Just let me know if you like the food here. I'll invite you back for a feast!
Highly recommended. Will return many many times. A+++Xem thÃªm

Not very good and ridiculously overpriced. I went here with my someone and we ordered 4 dishes: a plate of fried rice, some stir-fried kailan with garlic, Kinh Do pork ribs & shrimp wrapped in tofu skin. Now I get that Chinese cuisine can be very oily but everything here was drenched in oil  (that kailan dish, GURL). And then the price. Also GURL. There are several upscale/casual places that serves the same cuisine with better quality and with half the prices: Va ThÃ nh, Madam Oyster. Does not recommend and will not come back.

All best Chinese food here!
Quick service with delicous hot dishes!

Minus 1 star since all waiters try to persuade us to most expensive choice (!)
Even I try to tell that only supper.meal a simple waton noodle but he ask me to try king schrimpt many times...
Seem they love high bill than loyal customers (!)
Poor ducky
gud place 2 come when  u visit Ho Chi Minh city

The food had a lot of flavor. Ordered black chicken soup, banh canh cua, schezwan fried chicken and squid, oc huong snails (very spendy), crab congee, and sapoche smoothie. All the food was delicious. Service was good and food served timely and hot. The place is clean. Great place for foreigners to have Vietnamese food or Chinese whatever you like. I like to eat where the locals eat and so give it a try.
Dim sum mostly average. Hair in the har gow. Service inattentive. Disappointing because dinner was quite good. But, salted egg bun was terrific.
Staff is not friendly. We got half of our food because the waiter didn't wrote it correctly and had to wait more than 30min after we asked for it.
Dishes are great but we need to wait for too long.
Best Viet Chinese Food in town
24 hr. Chinese Restaurant.  They have the best Wondton & noodle soup! My favorite.  You will find a lot of people after clubbing or karaoke rendevous there.  Highly recommend going here.
Don't put so high expectation also .
Best comfort food for after clubbing or regular weekend dinner! Great mix of South Chinese and Vietnamese menu! Love the crab x.o glass noodle in a clay pot!
Pretty good place to head to after wild night/drinking in Saigon if you sre hungry. The restauranr is chinese style, so you can order from variety of dim sums, wonton noodles etc!
Not really good taste

The Peking Duck here is PERFECT and a must try

first the skin is wrap with rice wraps and served as a dish,

then some of the flesh is being stir fried with noodles and served as 2nd dish.

The rest are all deep fried with garlic and chilli, making it one of the best DUCK dish I've ever tasted !

Coming from Malaysia where we do have an extensive choice of chinese food, this still surprise me.

Service and Ambiance is not worth a mention, as all Chinese restaurants spot the same quality, it's the norm.
the interior is not really luxury but still good, the location is great, they have very delicious fried rice in Chinese-Saigonese style, must try.
Good place to eat after late nights in saigon...they open very late...
Good food, good service, after late night hangout
Was open at 4 am when I had jet lag.
Nice restsurant_Chinese-Vietnamese food. Koreans also like this restaurant because they have Korean Soju. My favorite in this restaurant is Sichuan tofu. Please try it with some rice.
Unfriendly staff and far too overpriced. The place lacked any atmosphere and was clearly just a money machine
The food is okay but the price too high

12.45pm ,  i arived here with my family with a two year old kid. After making order, the manager appeared and said that they close, donâ€™t receive order. Then I go to the Din Ki restaurant opposite. I saw that people still come in Tan  Hai Van. What happened???

Very fresh & special foods....highly recommended.

Quality of food has dropped in recent years. No longer serves authentic Chinese cuisine which is what the restaurant is themed on . . . Most dishes have been "localised"!
I like this restaurant's dimsum and beijing duck..good price and delicious..but don't expect good service much..
It used to be good but the service is terrible now. Nobody will open the door for you even if you are hands are busy holding your baby. The staff talk loudly to each other.
Dim sum is stale and not very good. Customer service is quick. Would rather go to Dim Tu Tac for dim sum.

Very friendly staff and good service.
Reasonable prices too.

But....taste was not enough for my family.
The dim sum is sub standard to me...very over cooked prawn...texture is hard and dry...wonder why is it so famous here.
Good service, delicious food and a nice aquarium.

Service was a bit slow during lunch but food was good
The food was ok. Not the very best dimsum I have ever had. The price is a bit higher than other places
Good food.  Efficient service.  Felt rushed though but food is authentic Chinese.
Awesome food. Pricey for average Vietnamese restaurant but is expected for district 1

Honestly was pretty flavorless and a bit disappointing.   I think I had better meals in the airport terminal restaurants on my way here.
Various kinds of duck recipes. The ducks are really huge and delicious. A good choice for your dinner
Peking duck with soup or porridge options. Min 6 people should be per 1 Peking duck. Taro smoothie is a must have.
Food is ok. Ask price before ordering. It can pricy.
Small portion sizes for the price compared to the rest of Vietnam, although it was fresh and clean - unfortunately, it was nothing extraordinary
Food quite expensive...not really worth the price and the value...taste very normal
Very good for the price, good flexibility when you order food, fast service

Wide arrays of food to choose from . Tastes nice . Prompt service . Love the congee.  And all the food.

Very delicious and fresh seafood. We ordered the Deluxe seafood platter and was not disappointed with the amount of variety + fresh seafood. The space is very fancy. The service is really good. Love their design. Extraordinary food
Old money style restaurant. Foods were from good to great.

We had a great time with family in this awesome restaurant. I really love lobster,crab here really fresh and well cooked and the taste is good too. The staffs are friendly and make us feel comfortable

Very tasty. The restaurant is for seafoods and it was very calm and quite environment to dine for professionals. They accomodate family too. The food doesn't bother your stomach. We felt light even after having many varieties.

A great dining experience near the center of HCMC.

Decor- classic elegant European blended in with modern. It's got public area and private dining area that can hold up to 20 people for a private party.
Food- wide selection of super fresh and tasty seafood and amazing steak and pork ribs for choose. They are a great fusion style.
Drinks- signature award winning cocktails and variety of both alcohol and non alcohol drinks. You'll be more than satisfied.

We even had the live band in our private dining area for 3 songs of our choice. We loved it!

Great food, clean, classy. Best spring rolls Iâ€™ve had in my life. Highly recommend.

Sit upstairs, thereâ€™s 2 guys playing live music and they are amazing.

This is by far the best seafood ğŸ¦ restaurant in HCM. Spices and herds are well balance, service is spot on. John the GM, he is so gracious and personally poured me a glass of wine. Indeed solid and unpretentious institution. ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

Upper range of seafood establishments. Second floor in front of live band. Played mostly 90s classic blues, jazz type music. Wonderful atmosphere, food was good. Service was very good. Good for special occasions and business lunch to impress Europeans.
We had a wonderful dinner experience at  Ngoc Suong.  We had  crab with tamarind sauce, steamed prawn coconut juice and it was very good.  The service was impeccable.

Ngoc Suong is a great spot. The food is good and not all that expensive. You need to try seafood spring roll, fish carpaccio with peanut homemade sauce, special lobster in 3 style , so good. All the mains Iâ€™ve ever eaten here are good as well. Highly recommend
Outstanding food and service. The staff helped us decide on the perfect food and gave us a great experience. A little pricey but worth it, I would definitely go back.
Delicious sea food, especially their fish salad and prawns, a bit pricy though. Nice decorations like on a ship with singer performancing.
Wonderful experience for dining in Ngoc Suong. Its exactly what I want the Vietnam style & taste with delicious seafood. Reasonable price! Highly recommended.
Great food, friendly staffs, stunning ambience and lovely music. Please book the table in advance if youre visiting on Friday or Saturday night.
Great sea-food. There's live music at 1st floor at night (7pm-9pm). Good for meals with family or guests.

I like atmosphere most, a warm space since its architecture is from wood. Food is very fresh.
Interesting live music.
Great place to hang out with friends at weekend. Warmly and cosy. Seafood is pretty good. Fast service with nice staffs.
Best steam shrimp. They cooked with coconut. When they served, they shrimp into coconut and grill from outside. It made the unique aroma. Love love
Good foods . Staffs are friendly and very helpful. Good choice for family garthering.

Wonderful dinner with our business partners in Vietnam. We have travel long way to Vietnam to see our business partners. Having dinner here was absolutely amazing. Friendly services, fresh food, hygiene and TASTY!!!
$500USD for 2 old people and 1 child, costs more than New York City. Definitely not worth it.

Beautifully decor restaurant with good seafood
Suitable for group booking.
Good service
Very delicious food and great Interieur
Food was average and price pretty high.
Great atmosphere with live music and good food with good drink selections.  Can't beat the service at this restaurant with the price and the food quality.

The best and luxury seafood restaurant in Saigon!

Excellent vietnamese sea food restaurant.
One of the oldest in town. The place classically beautiful,  very well maintained,  very clean , the personnel very kind , the food  excellent cooked,  and for last reasonable priced. What else you can ask.

A comfortable place to dine not only with aline but also to people you need to take time sharing a table with may it be a collegue , a workmate , anybody can fit with the sorroundings and ambience .
Nice atmosphere, live music. A little up class. Food is good - fusion of French and Vietnamese cuisine , service is excellent. Not cheap.

Rice paper is relatively chewier than regular ones, and comes with a mountain of a variety of herbs that you can include in your wrap, along with pickled veggies, cucumbers and bean sprouts.

The Bo La Lop is pork wrapped with betel leaves, very juicy and fragrant when combined with crushed peanuts. Pork Cha Gio and Crab Cha Gio both had great crispy texture, but the latter was a little bland. Nem Nuong was moist, savory with a hint of sweetness. Pig Ear and Hock were tender, with the crisp of the cartilage.

The Bamboo Nuoc Mam Salad was also very addicting, a perfect balance of sweet and umami, served with shrimp chips.

For more photos check out @bredgyeats!

During my business trip to Vietnam, I was looking for a massage shop near the hotel! Surprisingly, the service is fantastic, and massage therapy is really relaxing. It helps me sleep better. I think I will come back to this place on my next business trip. Highly recomended
Amazing fried or oven baked fish.  With leaf wraps and all that jazz.  Can feed 4 comfortably with 500k

The location Iâ€™m reviewing more about is near Nguyen Trai.

Love this place! Delicious food. This place gets quite busy fast and almost all the time, so be ready. I would recommend that they remodel or clean up the restaurant more, especially the floors. Theyâ€™re always sticky and dirty.
The frog congee is delicious, and staffs are friendly. I have been here a few times. The place needs an upgrade, deodorant and deep clean. Perhaps it is time for renovation.

I went there with a big group of about 12 people. We ordered almost everything they have. For it's price, the place has really good food. The frogs tasted fresh and the staff were friendly. The worst one was probably the salted egg one. The rest was really delicious. None of the dishes were really spicy (as I'm not good at eating spicy food). The place looks a bit sloppy and not very clean. Keep in mind that this place only sells food with frogs. If you have never tried frog meat I would recommend this place.

They know how to make a great taste of frogs!
Good price. Variety dishes. Smoothies and tea from drinks menu are delicious, but out of order sometimes.
Recommended dishes: áº¾ch rang trá»©ng muá»‘i (frog roasted in salt egg york sauce), Náº¥m kim chÃ¢m rang muá»‘i á»›t (enoki mushrooms roasted with jalapeÃ±os and green onions).

Fried frogs with salt sauce is pretty bomb. My girl and I really like it and we also got frog hot pot. Iâ€™m gonna hit 9/10 for foods, servers are nice as well but WC ğŸ™ğŸ¤¢. We will come back for the food. â€¦

Frog, frog and frog any way you could want it. Dishes ran from quite good to just edible. Outdoor seating. Friendly service. The map marker is off by about 30 meters but cannot be edited. Keep going down the block after mr google says you have arrived.

My go-to place for butter-fried frogs. That thing is amazing here. The flavour has always been on point. The frog rice is an another great menu item here. The sauce that is used to coat the rice is just bomb. Service is great and quick. Although the restaurant's cleanliness could use some improvement.
Every dish is involved with frog from salad, fried, soup to hot pot. Food is okay but the restaurant is not very well cleaned.

Best frog in town.
Curry flavors are amazing.
Drinks good price and large size, especially honey alovera

It's a local Vietnamese restaurant serving hot pots and other Vietnamese food. Ordered few platters like okra and fried rolls and frogs. Hot and cold appetisers were good. Not sure about the frog pot as it was only one frog in the pot.
Tasty dishes, even though Im not a fan of frog. A bit pricy and slow service.
Although i am do not like frog much, but i must said that the foods were very delicious
Food current is not delicious as beginning (4-5 years before). And staff attitude is not really good.
Ordered three platters, two hot and cold appetisers and one frogs hot pot. All good but the hot pot wasn't generous. The place itself is a Vietnamese restaurant serving Vietnamese food.

Crowded popular restaurant serving frogs. Fried frogs served with salted egg sauce is highly recommended. Others are OK, not really excellent, a bit salty to me. Average price range. You'll get full and satisfied at a good price.

3 dishes that are a must for me whenever I go there. Chao ech Singapore, ech rang trung muoi & da ech. I'm from Singapore, I know their standard. 5 stars. Not even the best in Singapore can beat this. Thumbs up! ğŸ‘ğŸ˜‹ â€¦
Nice frog dishes if you like this specialty. However, it doesn't have the most attentive staff. They missed an order which we had to wait longer for.

Staffs are lazy, just chit chat. We have to wait very long time for the food, although we had ordered before we came. We had to remind them so many times. But they just laught, then they continued to chit chat. I felt so disappointed.
Terrible experience. Ordered seafood pineapple fried rice. Got order wrong twice. Finally the dish came out full of round dried sausage and absolutely no seafood. Don't eat here!!!
Like food here very much, as always. Tasty even it's a side dish. Lunch time is busy all the time. Services are supposed to faster.
Overall, the food is pretty good.  The flavor is a bit on the sweet side.  It would get 4 stars if service is better

The food is ok but the service is very bad ! The waiter is very slow to take order and the food is slow to come ! One dish by one coming to the table ! It write since 2009 it open but they only accept cash ! No credit card allow
Good food, reasonable price, however the restaurant is small, need to pre-order to cut off waiting time ğŸ˜Š â€¦
Delicious and vary food from frog. Service is quite below standard and no card accepted.
very nice food generally, but serving takes a long time, especially at high time
Good food
Very delicious, a lÃ³t of kind of food, hot spot, fried, vegeterian...with reasonable price
Fresh frog if that is your thing. This is one of their first shops and is the most crowded. Suggest calling in advance for a table.
Good food but old facilities and quite small. Very crowded.
Delicious foods with special frog. The best frog meals in Saigon
Slow service and really old restaurant with low maintenance. Food is okay.
Delicious and suit my local favor. Recomend for who want to try Vietnamese
Excellent food. Fair prices and nice staffs.
Frog is so delicious. Small space. Good for family.
The food is delicious but services take long time
Good food, but services so so
Food is ok, but wait to long

Food is good but restaurant is messy
lovely staffs, usually full of customers

food is quite nice.
I am sitting on the curb.
theserver kept refilling our beer which is very rare in vietnam.
can try again
Service was very good. We sat outside, little polluted but at least there was a slight breeze. Food is good there, had a bit of everything.

This place is so bad. I have no idea how it has higher ratings-- perhaps my experience was just particularly bad.

Ironically,  most of the seafood was sold out. The food was very bland and was more filler than main dish (i.e.: more vegetables than noodles). Food took incredibly long to come out, and we ended up cancelling 3-5 dishes because they were taking so long, despite being non-seafood dishes. The fried rice was also gross, not sure why... Our fried fish (with veggies and rice paper for rolling) came with plantains but it was unripe and left my mouth shockingly dry.

The wet wipes cost money and a bottle of water is overpriced. I understand this is a "higher end" place, but this was so bad. For the same price at home (America), I could get something that tastes way better.

The service was terrible. I watched our food be brought to another table before they said it wasn't there's. It took over 10 minutes to get the check calculated. One member of my party was missing plates and dinnerware. We had to ask 4 times for it to finally be brought out. My parents were yelled at by staff for looking at the fish tanks.

Loved this place. Fresh seafood, acceptable prices.

Went there 2 nights in a row.

Delicious & fresh seafood !

Good inn to enjoy food & see the traffic of Saigon.

Supportive staff!
good food, great quality seafood at decent price, good cook, fast and friendly services
Best for party...i really enjoy sea food here! Good service!

I'm Vietkue from California, First time came to this restaurant, I have a horrible experience here. It takes 10 mins to order a beer, then we have to asked for refilled. I don't usually write reviews on here but why I have to asked to put ice in my cup. It takes almost 20mins to get my first dish like wow....

Great place for late night food. The oysters were very fresh and the sung ga rang muoi was also good. Big area with a kit of customers. Service is decent and they serve beer as well till late . Normally gets busy around 1 am when all the bars close.

I think even a single star was generous because this place had decent food but terrible service. It was a complete mess and made me order water 5 times before they were even able to get me my water. They were all out confused and even paying the bill was a pain and for such a huge sum of money I believe you could eat at a way better spot. This would only be recommended if you want a place to waste money.
The service was pretty bad for a place this expensive. The food was good but we couldn't even order rice. They couldn't understand us. And they brought it really really late.
The best seafood restaurant in Saigon. Food is delicious, atmosphere is good
Poor Service.  first order was wrong.Second took 30 mins for a salad. Over pricing
Don't miss the golden shrimp here. The chef cooked very delicious!!
Good place for fresh seafood and more local atmosphere.
Food excellent
cheap and good taste and pretty girl!
Very nice food and place to drink
Outdoor seafood restaurant, it's ok.

I have been in this restaurant 2 times because my relative has taken me there. Characteristic of this restautant is that they have an audience Karaoke, but they only have Vietnamese singers, do not find Chinese or English singers. There is a local culture that I didn't realize at the beginning was that you put a tip in a rose and give it to those who sang, but the singer was not supposed to keep the tip. Tips are intended for those who work to find melody or those who play instruments :-O Fun but noise for those who can stand it.
The food is average, but there are many people who were there anyway :-)

Hello. We come from Brussels and we know this restaurant at the time that it is still located in Saigon Square and I must admit that we are very very disappointed with the quality of the service offered which is very far from its reputation as one of the best restaurants in Saigon. The welcome at the reception entrance is very poor, not to say 0. we are seated on the terrace and we have ordered 5 dishes for 2 people. you have to think about providing cold beers in the fridge. 1 st dish after 30 m alone. Then after 30 m we ask where are the next dishes and the young waitress without experience warmly announces to us that 2 dishes out of 5 ordered no longer exist. We receive our 2 nd dish after 1 hour and without more. And finally after insisting with the manager the 3rd main course arrives after 1h30 of waiting so we are disappointed and ask for the bill to leave. Very bad experience. Non-existent service below everything. Van Tri from Belgium Brussels.

This Japanese restaurant has great prices but a rather unusual menu. Everything is deep fried, it seems, and although the tables have bbq plates there are no bbq options available. The udon also strangely had no meat and curry powder in some of the toppings (my dining partner doesnâ€™t like curry seasoning; I thought it was pretty good). The fish sandwich was tasty, but with unripe tomatoes, and the potato croquettes were also decently good. everything was fresh and hot.
Excellent value for money! I had many delicious pieces of steak of high quality for a very fair price!
Nice food & reasonable price. Quite location. Suitable for group & family gathering.

The restaurant was really good, the chef was very friendly and the service is not fast but extremely convenient . The place is supper suitable for who want to have a meeting, a party or a meal where you can enjoy Japan foods
Warm service, profesional chef, great decoration and atmosphere, lower than expected price. Must visit if u wanna try Japanese cuisine in Sai Gon.
Great food at reasonable price, helpful staff.

This is one of the most famous wedding restaurants in HCMC. They offer lots of wedding combos and discounts. If you test each dish from the combos, it is delicious. But when it comes to the wedding night, the dishes from that same combo arent really in the similar impression. Especially the red wine beef stew, it is a nightmare to me. The taste of sauce and vegetables is good, but the meat is not fork-tender. It is as chewy as rubber and completely dry.
In general, this is still a beautiful and affordable place for a wedding night for young couples ğŸ’. Just need to put some effort into the food.

The place us suitable for wedding where you get to enjoy all the traditional Vietnamese food, the band music know all the Vietnamese song you're throwing at them, so go ahead and sing to your heart content. The room is spacious and can fit more than 100 people, the main hall is suitable for photograph. The only cons is there is no Wifi
